reference.title: Lift Preparation and Execution for complex lifts

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Lift Preparation and Execution for Complex Lifts

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Provides procedures for planning, preparing and executing complex lifts including roles, checks, and communications to ensure safe operations.

othermeta.name: taxonomy
othermeta.content: domain:lifting and rigging;usecase:complex lift planning and execution;industry:glass manufacturing heavy machinery and industrial equipment

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: plan and execute complex lifts safely and compliantly

ol.li: Develop clear criteria for what constitutes a complex lift and require such lifts to have a documented risk assessment and lift plan completed prior to each complex lifting activity.
Ensure that a pre-start checklist/inspection is completed prior to operating the lifting equipment.
Verify the ground is suitable for safe operation of cranes and, where they are fitted, deploy outriggers.
Ensure that the area of the lifting operation is adequately illuminated and external conditions are assessed and controlled.

Only operate cranes, hoists, and lifting equipment within the specified lifting rating. Ensure that the rated load capacity of a crane's bridge, individual hoist, or any sling or fitting is not exceeded. Know the weight of the object being lifted.
Engage loads properly on hooks with hook latch in lock position where fitted.
Isolate the work area and define and manage the operational area using barricades and spotters to prevent the risk of injury from the equipment or the load falling or striking people.
Persons must not under any circumstances enter an area under a suspended load, and never leave suspended loads unattended.
Complex lifts must be supervised and tag lines must be used where a load requires steadying or guidance.
